p: The most common outpatient medications involved in significant DDIs (category 3 or 4) with the most recently approved DAA regimens, VEL/SOF (n = 58), GLE/PIB (n = 46), and ELB/GRZ (n = 73), were proton pump inhibitors (PPIs), metamizole, statins, and carvedilol ( Supplementary Table 6). More precise information on relevant DDIs and their respective mechanisms can be found in the Supplementary Data ( Supplementary Table 7).
